p: Human cases of MAY are sporadic and mainly involve people who live in rainforests, as the main vector is the Haemagogus mosquitoes that are common in those forests. Vertebrate hosts are mainly mammals, although there is some evidence of bird infections in southern Brazil. Aedes mosquitoes can also transmit the virus in rural, suburban, and urban areas [ 14]. The course of 3â€“5 day of illness is characterized by fever, headache, myalgia, rash, and pain, mainly in the large joints, and less often, arthritis [ 15, 16]. The spread of this virus can extend to cities through an infected human or through birds that can travel long distances in a short time, and adapt to a new cycle that involves humans as reservoirs.
